newsitem.title: USA: U.S. corp bonds off with Treasuries, light trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. corp bonds off with Treasuries, light trade.

text.p: U.S. high-grade corporate bonds were off at midday tracking U.S. Treasuries in light trading, dealers said.
"We saw some trading activity on the offered side of the market and there's generally a good bid for corporate paper," one trader said.
High-grade corporate dealers said spreads across most maturities were one to two basis points tighter.
Other dealers said the market was in a holding pattern in the absence of any fresh economic data and post holiday doldrums.
"We're in a holding pattern," said one trader. "There's no riveting news today...people are focusing on Friday's jobs report."

In the new issue arena, Associates Corp of North America, a Ford Motor unit, stirred up some activity in an eerily quiet primary market pricing $400 million in two-year notes via lead manager Merrill Lynch & Co.
The AA3/AA-minus rated 6.50 percent notes were priced at 99.954 to yield 6.525 or 17 basis points over comparable U.S. Treasuries.
Still, primary and secondary corporate bond activity is expected to remain quiet ahead of the highly anticipated U.S. employment report later this week, dealers added.
On Friday, the U.S. Labor Department is scheduled to release the August employment report at 0830 EDT/1230 GMT.
In a Reuter poll, U.S. economist predicted an increase of 244,000 in nonfarm payrolls and expect the unemployment rate to dip slightly to 5.3 percent from 5.4 percent.
Meanwhile, in the high-yield market, prices were quoted off 1/8 to 1/4 in quiet dealings, traders said.
